cyclone.name: FRANKLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles SSW of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest for another day, then forecast to turn sharply north toward Hispaniola and later northeast into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern coast of Hispaniola (Dominican Republic/Haiti border area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Haiti entire south coast and Dominican Republic south coast (Isla Saona westward to Haiti border)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands to Hispaniola south and north coasts
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds up to the lower end of tropical-storm force (35–45 mph) possible Tuesday–early Wednesday, mainly southern and western PR; lower in San Juan.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat expected for San Juan’s north-facing harbor while the center stays well south.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Tuesday into Wednesday could total 2–4 inches, locally higher, producing ponding on port grounds and localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls with lightning and reduced visibility may disrupt cargo operations.
